intro: Doliocarpus lancifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leafed doliocarpus, is a tropical shrub belonging to the family Anacardiaceae. It is characterized by its elongated, lance-shaped leaves that are often leathery and have a distinctive reddish or purple coloration on the underside. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by bright red, fleshy berries that are an important food source for various wildlife. It is native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America, where it thrives in humid, tropical climates. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
